acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The material of this collection was made a gift to Alderman Library in accordance with the wishes she expressed during her life by Mrs. Amanda Stewart Bryan Kane of Charlottesville, Virginia, on February 28, 1992.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: There are sixteen items, 1929-1994, chiefly letters of Sister Lucy Julien Hill to Amanda Bryan Kane. Other items include a printed article; two photographs, 1929 and n.d., of Hill; a silhouette of an unidentified man; and, a letter postmarked July 5, 1994, from Shelah [Kane Scott], Charlottesville, to Anne Freudenberg, concerning the letters contained in this collection.

1944 Oct 23 Quebec, Canada: condolences and comfort on the death of "Uncle Stewart" [John Stewart Bryan (1871-1944)]; mentions [his wife] "Aunt Anne" [Anne Eliza Tennant Bryan]; religious support.
1949 Jun 12 Angers, France: circumstances keeping her in Angers until at least September, so not being able to leave to meet Amanda [in Paris]; trying to make arrangements for Amanda to travel to Angers, "a fascinating little town...in the Chateau country"; mentions "Aunt Anne" [Anne Eliza Tennant Bryan], May and Harry.
1967 Oct 20 Paris, France: the Kanes' -- Amanda and Keith -- plan to visit Lyon, France and see Sister Lucy; description of the convent; news of various visitors; "Aunt Nellie's" death; Amanda's travels; visits from "Crash," Anne's oldest son and from Mary [Ethel] Kennard, Boley's youngest girl; mentions "Uncle Tom," Mary Hill, Boley [Kennard].
1968 Feb 6 Paris, France: Mother General's visit and future plans; visit by Mary [Ethel] Kennard and her sister Anne Maury [Kennard]; activities at the convent; mentions Mary Bishop, Anne [Kane McGuire] and her children, Ned, Amanda, and Cathy.
1968 Feb 10 Paris, France: news of nieces Anne Maury Kennard and Mary Ethel Kennard; receiving a genealogy chart of the Fontaine-Maury line of the family; religious thoughts.
1968 Feb 27 Paris, France: Amanda's impending visit on March 25, Annunciation day, and planned activities for the day.
1974 Dec 29 Lyon, France: season's greetings with news of and comments on family and friends; religious ceremonies; refers to the sadness of Keith's absence this holiday season; mentions Anne [Kane McGuire], Shelah [Kane Scott], Billy, Frances, Hopie, Lee, Mary Wingfield Scott, and Alice.
1975 Feb 11 Lyon, France: enclosing for Amanda a "beautiful letter of Keith's" sent to Sister Lucy in March 1973, and commenting on the spirituality of the letter. Enclosure of March 1 1963 letter, Keith Kane to Sister Lucy: letterhead Hotel Excelsior, Napoli, Italy: very personal and spiritual letter.
1975 Feb 11 Lyon, France: personal news; news of "deep snow" in Charlottesville; mentions Anne [ ] and son Raymond Bowers, a University of Virginia student.
1975 Sep 19 Lyon, France: convent activities; personal news; [David] Tennant's [Bryan] 70th birthday celebration; mentions Richard Fife, "little Sarah".
1988 Dec 21 Lyon, France: Christmas card.
